column1: This game may be played by four
column3: or eight players. Two players toss up for the first choice of partners; the winner also has the right for his side to be "call" or to "reply."After sides are chosen
column4: the winner of the toss consults with his side
column5: and they decide whether they will "call" or "reply." "Call" is considered the better position.The game is played with a map of the United States made of perfectly plain pasteboard with each State a separate piece
column6: and without names or marks of any kind on the pieces.This map should be large enough to have Rhode Island about one inch long
column7: and the game should be played around a table with the sides named North
column10: and West.The side which "calls" takes all of the States in a box.
